description: Ms. codex. Title provided by cataloger. 19 to 23 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. European? glazed paper with laid and chain lines visible. On fol. 1a: Table of contents and several ownership statements and seals. On first back fly-leaf: mention "214 ʻayn" in Arabic. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. The last text is dated Mārdīn, Jumādá al-Ulá 1042 and signed ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Ibrāhīm (colophon, fol. 87b).
author: Dawwānī, Muḥammad ibn Asʻad, 1426 or 1427-1512 or 1513
abstract: Collection of texts comprising Risālat Ithbāt al-wājib of Jalāl al-Dīn al-Dawwānī, a commentary by Mullā Ḥanafī [Muḥammad al-Tabrīzī al-Ḥanafī in Mach, R. Yahuda], and a supergloss by Mīrzā Jān Ḥabīb Allāh al-Shīrāzī.
contents: 4. fol. 58a-87b: Mīrzā Jān ʻalā Ithbāt al-wājib / [Ḥabīb Allāh] Mīrzā Jān.
extent: i, 87, i leaves: paper ; 206 x 147 (140-155 x 70-80) mm. bound to 210 x 165 mm.
title: Risālah qadīmah li-ithbāt al-wājib ... [etc.].
creator: دواني، محمد بن اسعد
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Brown leather over paper pasteboard for upper and lower covers and envelope flap. Traces of a blind-tooled decoration with frame made of fillets and stamps. Rebacked. Paper pastedowns and endleaves.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
